Item.ReviewTitle: The NEW iPad, Very Impressive, Very Addictive
Item.Review:
Pros: Versatile, Size, Display, Graphics, Performs as Advertised
Cons: Other than it getting warm, none.
If you’re a new prospect to the iPad, I encourage you to read this review. To get the main issue out of the way, yes as mentioned, the tablet does get warm, so if your laying in bed with it sitting on your stomach, it will get uncomfortable. Place a pillow in between and your set. But you are definitely not going to get burnt. Done. Aside from this, the quality is superb. You will find many applications that will work in hand with the brilliant retina display. For entertainment or educational purpose, explore the galaxy /space applications such as Solar Walk and Wonders. They will blow you away with the vivid crisp colors enhanced for this version iPad. For business, Iw ... orks Numbers and Pages will look elegant and will make your iPad a great business tool, also Quick OfficeHD, Evernote, Dragon Dictation and Informant HD are one of the must have apps to install. They are enhanced for the New iPad and great tools for working with documents, MS Office files, notations and organization. Games, that’s up to preference, but you can start by exploring Real Racing2 HD, Batman, X-Plane, Infinite Flight and yes Angry Birds Space. Living earth App is an exceptional alarm clock that displays the earth in an ultra high resolution of the earth, also enhanced for the New iPad which will display the earth’s clouds as they are in real life as well as show where its day and night in real world time. You will find the New iPad to operate graphic hungry apps smoothly. Battery life is as advertised and won’t disappoint. Verizon data service with the 4G, is lightning fast, impressive and you can quickly switch from using your home Wi-Fi to Verizon Data and back very fast and easy to conserve your Verizon Data usage. For protection I will highly recommend the BodyGuardz clear full body protection cover films that fit perfectly and are easily installed using the included liquid gel packets. Purchase it directly online. Bodyguardz feel is much smoother than the more rigid feel using the Zagg ... expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Apple iPad Wi-Fi + Cellular 16 GB - 3rd generation - Verizon Wireless - Black
Item.Review:
Pros: Screen resolution and clarity
Cons: Nothing yet.
This is my first iPad purchase and I thought I was just going to buy the iPad 2 and that would suit me just fine for 399. So I bought the second-generation iPad and used it, but small text was really hard to see without zooming in on it every time. I then thought that maybe I should take a look at the new iPad and maybe I could justify paying more for it. It is worth the extra $ believe me!
The screen is amazing and absolutely beautiful. Even the smallest print on the screen is razor sharp and easy to read without eye strain or zooming in. I opted for the 4G version because I plan on keeping this for several years and the connectivity will be nice when traveling. Yes I could tether my phone, but it kills the batter ... y quickly.
If you own the iPad 2 and don't have problems with the screen resolution when viewing or reading text then don't upgrade; you won't get much out of the third generation. If this is your first tablet (like me) spend the extra $100 and get this third generation, the screen alone is worth the extra money. expand » « collapse

Item.ReviewTitle: IPad 3 temperture too hot and weight is heavy
Item.Review:
Pros: IPad 2 runs cooler, lighter wight, and is a better value.
Cons: Temperture of unit too hot and heavy.
Bubbles appeared on the screen after a while. I think the temperature of the IPad was excessive and may of caused the bubbles? Battery duration is not worth the extra weight. The charger was so hot after charging the charger almost burnt my fingers when unplugging it. The IPad 3 was also heavier than the IPad 2. Sorry, going to return for an IPad 2 or wait for the IPad 4. Not impressed with the IPad 3, especially considering the cost. Also, the Ipads are delicate/easily broken, not worth the price. Use a smart phone instead.

Item.Item: Apple iPad Wi-Fi + Cellular 16 GB - 3rd generation - Verizon Wireless - Black
Item.ReviewTitle: This is the tablet you're looking for.
Item.Review:
Pros: The app selection. Quality. Ease of use. Battery life is great. Screen looks great. has essentially replaced my laptop.
Cons: I will sometimes prefer the actual web page over the mobile version of the page. But that will happen on any tablet.
Usually my wife is not a fan of my tech purchases. This one she reluctantly conceded as a good purchase. We've had this for about 5 months now.
We did buy an Apple Wireless Keyboard to pair with this iPad and my ancient laptop, but the keyboard on the iPad is fairly convenient. I don't play a lot of games, but my toddler son enjoys the educational games that I've loaded. Some of them are freaking amazing. I try to work on certain things--basic math, reading, spelling--but some of these apps just motivate the kids. O ... ne of them in particular got my son started on reading. We tried to get him do that with the Leapfrog Tag system, but that failed. But there's something about an iPad that just rubs kids the right way. They love digital stickers. It worked with a buddy's kid too, so I know it's not just my kid. Anyways, the educational apps are great so I just had to note that.
Aside from that, the LTE is fast. So fast that it is is sometimes easier to do work on my iPad them it is on my work computer with T1 access. (But a part of that is also the touchscreen aspect of the tablet and the nature of my work.)
The retina display looks great. The interface is easy to use. Sometimes, I'd wish it'd be louder, but then that could be the site I'm on because it can also be quite loud.
The battery life is outstanding. I sometimes find myself doing hours of work on it just so I can drain it down to recharge. I think I recharged this two weeks ago and I'm at 52% battery life right now, and I use it daily, probably an average of 30 minutes each day.
Could I live without one? Sure. But if you're looking for a tablet that won't disappoint, this is it. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Apple iPad Wi-Fi + Cellular 16 GB - 3rd generation - Verizon Wireless - Black
Item.Review: I never had an iPad or iPhone, but since I was very pleased with the new 13 MacBookPro I bought to my wife last fall, I decided to buy the new iPad. I had few reason for buying: 1) use it while traveling, for maps (and navigation in car), occasional internet access (weather, hotels lookup, sightseeing tips etc.) 2) testing of web application, as developing them is my job 3) comfortable web browsing while sitting on a sofa in living room So far, I've used my new iPad for all mentioned thing and was very happy with it. Following are highlights of usage. Pros: 1) iOS UI + Retina display, look & feel of Apple product is remarkable. 2) Easy to use, quick to learn even when you never used a touch device before (my case). 3) App store with lots of free apps, easily installable and maintai ... nable. 4) Quite comfortable touch keayboard (never used any other before, so I have no comparison to other vendors / devices, just a subjective feeling). In landscape mode, while the iPad is firmly placed on some surface, I'm able to type by both hands with many finger, like on a standard keyboard. Cons: 1) Touch keyboard does not contain navigation arrows (I miss especially left and right), so editing of some text (note, URL in address bar, search term, input in for web form) could be quite a pain. You could still use the touch and magnifier, but it's a pain and inaccurate. I still don't get it why Jobs resisted those keys and why are they missing on iPad :-) 2) I would prefer slightly wider frame, I sometimes touch display by accident while holding it in second hand. Overall, definitely very good piece of hardware and worth to buy if you plan to be online on the way. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Apple iPad Wi-Fi + Cellular 16 GB - 3rd generation - Verizon Wireless - Black
Item.Review:
Pros: Updated screen resolution and 4g
Cons: Nothing Earth shattering to have warranted an upgrade from the IPAD2
If you have an Ipad 2 and was seriously considering upgrading to the Ipad 3, well think again. I traded my IPAD 2 in for $390 (829 Originally) and thought that it was a small price to pay for a newer "improved" model. I have not been overly impressed and did not feel I got my value for money in terms of feature functionality. The updated screen and camera is really nice. more clarity and detail but you would have to keep the 2 units side by side to remember how good or not so good the other one is. The updated camera is great for pictures on the go if you carry your tablet places. I did not get much use of the 4G since most places have wifi these days and I only t ... ake out my credit card and pay for the 4G when I truely in a bind with no wifi. Another feature of the new Ipad is dictation. It works great, but in public places you are unlikely to start talking to yourself :-) So I lost $439 in my trade on my Ipad 2 and had to pay another $439 for the new one.... did I feel I got more out of the unit that warranted the high cost? No! But if the screen, updated camera, 4g and dictation are must have features then this is an awesome unit! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Apple iPad Wi-Fi + Cellular 16 GB - 3rd generation - Verizon Wireless - Black
Item.Review:
Pros: Screen resolution; iTunes ecosystem.
Cons: Apple's user experience control; Battery life; Runs hot!!
Good product, but not revolutionary. The screen resolution is definitely a plus, as are the available apps. However, don't fool yourself: the iPad is not a laptop replacement...
Overall, I'm fairly happy with my purchase, although I wish that Apple didn't exert so much control over the user experience - Apple doesn't always know what is best for everyone - and allowed users to tweak and configure more of the experience (I guess that is why so many users Jailbreak, although not the iPad3 yet...)
On the less positive column: battery life is not great, unless you significantly dim down the screen and do not use any app that uses CPU juice. As many have r ... eported earlier, it runs kind of hot. Make sure you keep it away from your crotch :) expand » « collapse

My only complaint is the rather long charging time. I guess I don't like to put it down and wait for it to charge up, as I am using it constantly to check email, Facebook and Twitter. The long battery life makes up for that though.
Did I mention how AWESOME it is?!?

Item.ReviewTitle: Twice the resolution & 4G LTE at no extra cost !

After having two previous iPad 2's and a Samsung Galaxy tab 10.1 - I can confidently say this is my best tablet yet. I loved my iPad 2 - not so much on the Samsung, mainly due to the iPads ease of use and performance.
The iPad 3 continues its ease of use tradition, and offers amazing clarity of text, and more vibrant photo production. I have yet to watch an hd movie on this iPad so I'm afraid I cannot comment on this aspect, nor have I tested its 4G capability as of this moment.
The only downsides are its slightly heavier, and slightly thicker, both of which are noticeable - at least to me.
I feel however that its a small price to pa ... y for a tablet with such an incredible screen compared to all other tablets currently on the market, while costing not a penny more.
Kudos to Apple ! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Apple iPad Wi-Fi + Cellular 16 GB - 3rd generation - Verizon Wireless - Black
Item.ReviewTitle: Fast, gorgeous, secure, but watch data usage
Item.Review:
Pros: High-resolution screen, long battery life, fast LTE, personal hotspot, web surfing, apps, security, iOS
Cons: Data usage controls & file management could be better, it's heavy
This is the first Apple product I’ve owned (although I used iPad 2 for a couple weeks). I use it mainly to read books & magazines and surf the web. Screen resolution really stands out when reading text, especially small print. Magazines are rendered beautifully and page turns are very responsive.. iOS and LTE make web browsing almost desktop quality. It does start feeling heavy after holding it for awhile. Compared to other OSes, iOS is superior in smooth, reliable performance, web surfing, apps and security, but inferior in terms of user customization , file management and multitasking. I ... don’t care for iTunes but chose to sync with iTunes instead of iCloud for fear of burning through my data plan with iCloud. I'm not sure if iOS uses data for background processes like other OSes, but I worry about data usage and battery life. So I wish there was an onscreen toggle to easily turn wifi and 4G on/off without diving into Settings. expand » « collapse

Use your smartphone as a hotspot and voila (pronounced "Vwa la") you have connectivity virtually every where you go. The ... I-Pad tablet is great but it's not worth the money. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Apple iPad Wi-Fi + Cellular 16 GB - 3rd generation - Verizon Wireless - Black
Item.Review:
Pros: Was in the dark ages with out it when away from my home PC

Where do I begin?
Is it the online science, gaming information, other research that I read anywhere and at any time that I was paying up to $140.00 a year for paper magazines to read on my lunch hour?
Is it the new car I just bought that I negotiated the best price all through email from this IPad? Oh and I calculated the best price for the car using a free spreadsheet App.
Is it the games like Mass Effect Infiltrator or a free exoplanet app that helps me track the latest exoplanet confirmations?
Is it the security features that let you not only lock it with a code b ... ut erase everything after 10 attempts?
Is it this free reminder app I found that helps me remember things that need to be done?
Is it the map app that pin points where I am so I can actually find something or is it listening to Pandora in my new CAR that I bought using my New IPad?!!
For me the IPad is not an excuse to leave the PC but an ability to compute and get something done when I am not at my home PC. expand » « collapse

I also got the Apple TV so I can mirror whatever is on my IPAD o ... nto my TV. This product is thin and light but at the same time the screen is large enough to enjoy movies and expand web pages to view them with larger font. The HD view is amazing! The apple mail system on the device allows you to add as many different email accounts in the email settings so all these emails goes to my IPAD in one central location. Just pure awesomeness! College, private, and work to one place to view. The Ipad is so light and mobil that you find yourself forgetting about using the desktop and laptop. I own all three and this thing is all I use unless my wife has it!!! IMO if your going to try to save a few bucks skip on the hard drive space over the 4G trust me you will not regrett it. Me and my wife arrive at Harris Teeter to do some shopping and she is like "i forgot to check if XYZ was on sale!" No problem I got my Ipad. I am now an Apple snob!!!!! Good bye PC!!!! So easy ..it truely is amazing! I'm going to buy another one just so I don't have to share it with my wife! Hope this helps!
P.S. I ran into a friend with a PC tablet and I was like "Do you love it?" She is like OMG Yeah!!! I smiled and pulled out my Ipad. She was like wow you blew alot of money. Yeah, they don't give these away. She was like mine can do every thing yours can do for half the price. Maybe, but can your tablet get on the internet? She shook her head "no." Well then no yours can do ever ... expand » « collapse

I like the upgraded screen, but the biggest thing for me is the speech to text feature. Coming from both Android and Ipad 2 which we both own, I really miss that feature on the Ipad 2 (company owned). My Wife has the new galaxy tab 7.7 and that is really great for travel as she can pack that away in car, purse, etc Our daughter like the smaller size for her games etc .It also has a great screen but the New Ipad works much better for web surfing and light computer use. In the end we use this a ton for around the house as a second computer and web, tv, netflix etc and it is simply great for those applications. Item.Item: Apple iPad Wi-Fi + Cellular 16 GB - 3rd generation - Verizon Wireless - Black
Item.ReviewTitle: Great for pictures and movies! Love it!

Item.Item: Apple iPad Wi-Fi + Cellular 16 GB - 3rd generation - Verizon Wireless - Black
Item.Review: We got our iPad last week in anticipation of a long road trip. We intend to use it to map out our route, find hotels & restaurants as well as information about our destinations. We also will download some of our photos onto the iPad. However, we have already used it at home, emailing, playing games and enjoying FaceTime with friends and family. An unanticipated find was that my husband's Kindle books can be read on the iPad. Now we can both e-read at the same time. This ability will be a bonus when we travel. The iPad was easy to set up and simple to use. Even my non-tecchie husband is using it easily. Thanks Apple for another great product.

Item.Item: Apple iPad Wi-Fi + Cellular 16 GB - 3rd generation - Verizon Wireless - Black
Item.Review:
Pros: The iPad is a great aid for my business needs.
Cons: Not a pc replacement...yet.
Great tablet!!! Wonderful apps. Great battery life!!! Best screen in class.

Item.Item: Apple iPad Wi-Fi + Cellular 16 GB - 3rd generation - Verizon Wireless - Black
Item.Review:
Pros: Display
Cons: I love everything about it.
I came from the original iPad so this is an awesome upgrade. I really enjoy everything about it, the speed, screen clarity, ease of use.....

Item.Item: Apple iPad Wi-Fi + Cellular 16 GB - 3rd generation - Verizon Wireless - Black
Item.Review:
Pros: EVERYTHING, great resolution, great apps, easy to use
Cons: It's a little spendy.
I wasn't sure about how useful a tablet would be, now I'm a believer! I have traded my laptop in and plan to go to an iMac desktop and use this as my portable computing device. It's much more convenient and does almost everything my laptop could do.

Item.Item: Apple iPad Wi-Fi + Cellular 16 GB - 3rd generation - Verizon Wireless - Black
Item.Review:
Pros: flexibility, ease of use, instant-on Internet access
Cons: text-intensive documents and text navigation; sound volume
I love the ability to have the instant-on access to the Internet. I used to drag out my laptop to do quick checks for things online, which was always such a time consuming labor. If I am working on a word document or other text-intensive tasks, the laptop is easier to work with (e.g., the ability to cut & paste, etc.) yet for Internet browsing, online banking, quick emails, calendar managment, etc., the iPad is fantastic. When I stream video, sometimes the sound volume is a little soft, which would be improved if the speaker were forward facing. Of course, when my kids get a hold of it to play games, I have a hard time getting it back!

Item.Item: Apple iPad Wi-Fi + Cellular 16 GB - 3rd generation - Verizon Wireless - Black
Item.Review:
Pros: Awsome screen display, loads of affordable apps, 4G capable.
Cons: The 4G networks just aren't prevalent enough to have a consistent connection.
This is a nice upgrade from the iPad 2. The screen resolution alone makes it worth the upgrade. It's very fast, and has a lot of great, already installed, apps to use. I read a lot of books, and the new screen is much easier on the eyes. For what I do with the iPad, I probably could have gotten by and been content with the 2, but now that I have the new iPad, I couldn't see myself going back.

Item.Item: Apple iPad Wi-Fi + Cellular 16 GB - 3rd generation - Verizon Wireless - Black
Item.Review:
Pros: Retina display
Cons: Battery charge time
As a previous 1st-gen iPad owner, I didn't jump on the iPad 2. Boy, am I glad I waited! The new iPad is incredible, and a great upgrade for 1st-gen users. iPad 2 owners might not be so inclined to upgrade, but the retina display may be enough of an excuse to upgrade, because it is all that it's cracked up to be.

Item.Item: Apple iPad Wi-Fi + Cellular 16 GB - 3rd generation - Verizon Wireless - Black

I also wish that Apple would add stereo speakers, that would make the video watch experience even more amazing.

I also use it as a study tool for my 8-year grandson - he loves studying now because it's still "playing" on the iPad! And it's lightening fast.....wouldn't be without it. Just a little disappointed in the sound quality but that's not a big deal to me.

Item.Item: Apple iPad Wi-Fi + Cellular 16 GB - 3rd generation - Verizon Wireless - Black

Personally,I think it's easier and better when you can control when you want the service, like a prepaid account.

Item.Item: Apple iPad Wi-Fi + Cellular 16 GB - 3rd generation - Verizon Wireless - Black
Item.ReviewTitle: Better camera, faster Internet, so easy to use

I absolutely loved my iPad 2 so I debated long and hard to upgrade. I had AT&T 3G on my old one and opted for verizon 4g this time around. What a huge difference in Internet speed! I used to have a hard time with the att service because in my area, I had a fairly low signal. I would have to go to a window or go outside when wifi was unavailable (which was very often, considering my job and college does not have wifi.. I know.. Unbelievable!) I can surf the web at anytime without lag and check my email and have it load every time. The camera is much better with this iPad and the microphone within the keyboard works great! No need to type, ... it is quite accurate! I am so glad I took the plunge because it is so much faster than the other (this can just be because in my area, Verizon rules and AT&T has a lot of spots where signal is very weak). expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Apple iPad Wi-Fi + Cellular 16 GB - 3rd generation - Verizon Wireless - Black
Item.Review:

Cons: Can't use anything requiring Flash player
I put off going Apple for many years. Not going to go with a product that has such a monopoly and won't play fair with others. I got this item as a gift as I would never spend this kind of money on myself. I'm in love!! My first day back to work after having it, felt like I was leaving my baby! I use it daily. I haven't even touched the amount of space that is available. The picture quality is amazing. Much better than my PC. The 4G and Wifi both have amazingly fast downloads, I never wait for internet to load or wait for buffering. My only complaint is that I can't use anything with flash player. If I could my computer would no longer be needed. I love the ICloud feature. I am now so hooked I'm getting the IPh ... one next! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Apple iPad Wi-Fi + Cellular 16 GB - 3rd generation - Verizon Wireless - Black
Item.Review:
Pros: Screen, 4G Speed
Cons: It Gets Very Hot
Let me just start by saying that I really love the iPad 1 and iPad 2 I had, and the new iPad does everything the previous models did so well... with a higher resolution screen, and 4G speed. I have always used my iPads all day long and have nearly replaced my desktop with the iPad.
However, the new iPad gets HOT! I have seen and heard many people say the new iPad gets warm, but mine gets HOT...so HOT that I need to turn it off because it is not comfortable to hold (in or out of a case).
This is so unfortunate because I am used to using my iPad very often, but I cannot use this one for an extended period of time.
In addition, the battery takes a very long time to charge, and a very short period of time to drain ... .
I know that a bigger battery is needed to power the incredible screen, etc. etc, etc, but unfortunately the heat and battery are not acceptable for me. I purchased my first new iPad on their opening day, and exchanged it two weeks later, but the new unit seems to get even hotter than the first one I purchased.
Perhaps if you never owned an iPad, this may not be a huge issue for you, but I am used to NO heat from the previous iPad models. None ever.
So unfortunately for me, the improved screen does not offset the heat and the speedy battery drain, and I am trying to locate an iPad 2 to exchange this one for, which is a difficult task.
Would I Recommend this to a Friend? No. Unless they were fully aware of exactly how hot these iPads can get, and they were okay with that. If they can handle the heat, it is awesome! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Apple iPad Wi-Fi + Cellular 16 GB - 3rd generation - Verizon Wireless - Black
Item.Review:
Pros: The screen really is awesome.
Cons: Nothing, I love everything!
Background: new to tablets. Previously had purchased a samsung galaxy tab. Do not own any type of smartphone.
I didn't want to get sucked into the new iPad hype, so I bought a Samsung Galaxy Tablet 10.1. I couldn't play HBOgo, Hulu, my flash-based game, The Sims Social on Facebook, and I kept getting booted off the net when I was surfing. I was very unhappy, and would leave the tablet and use my laptop instead. So I returned it within the fourteen day limit BestBuy gives you, btw I love Best Buy.
Then, I decided to get the new iPad. I was worried because of what I had read on the Internet, about the heat, and the issues that people were having with the wifi signal being too low where they prev ... iously had a good signal, and how you can't play flash games on it. I have had NONE of the issues.
The setup was very easy, and you need wifi to complete it. I started downloading my favorite apps, HBOgo, HuluPlus, ABC, Facebook, The Weather Channel, and iSwifter for my flash games. All of these apps work very well. I am very glad I did not listen to all the negative stuff out there.
The iPad will get warm, but not so warm that you cannot handle it. I have my brightness at about 50% and I am on it pretty much all day long, and the battery will last all day. I plug it in at night, and wake up to a fully charged iPad.
All in all, I am very happy with my iPad, I never want to put it down. I bought it with the 4G, but I am not using it now, since data plans are ridiculously expensive. I wanted the option for later, so I cannot really comment on the 4G.
I also have not tried to download full-length movies that come when you purchase a DVD at a retail store, so I do not know if that works well or not. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Apple iPad Wi-Fi + Cellular 16 GB - 3rd generation - Verizon Wireless - Black
Item.Review: I use my iPad for Netflix, Hulu, Skype, iMessage, Facetime, games, and for viewing photos taken from my iPhone through the photo streaming/icloud. I'm very impressed with the speed of the pad and the ease of use. I wish there were more HD apps, but they will come in time. For the HD apps out there, they are simply incredible. The screen is absolutely STUNNING! As far as the not-so-great, the biggest issue for me is that of charging. If you want to charge it, you need to have it plugged directly into the computer or use the included power supply. Just plugging it into a port on my USB hub will not work, but it works for my iPhone. I have another iphone wall jack, but it's not an apple one. My iPhone charges fine, but not the iPad. Because of this I bought an additional iPad char ... ger. One charge lasts a long time, I've discoverd that I use about 10% per hour (while streaming video), so the 10-hour charge that is advertised is about right for this. Charging doesn't happen fast though. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Apple iPad Wi-Fi + Cellular 16 GB - 3rd generation - Verizon Wireless - Black
Item.Review: I am using it for e-mail, music, photos, games, all my knitting patterns, books, maps, NYC subway and bus routes, NYC alternate side parking, internet, tide charts, etc. I could do most of these things on an iPod Touch or a smart phone but the screens are too small. The pictures are gorgeous and the books are easy to read. I got the 4G version since I want to use it places where Wi-Fi isn't available. The more I use it, the more uses I find. This is my first iPad - I resisted buying one until now. I wish It was easier to transfer documents to it. I should be able to just move documents to it directly when it's plugged into my computer rather than having to go through iTunes. I haven't yet used the camera or FaceTime.

Item.Item: Apple iPad Wi-Fi + Cellular 16 GB - 3rd generation - Verizon Wireless - Black
Item.ReviewTitle: Doest look like a school or business device
Item.Review:
Pros: battery and screen quality
Cons: audio has only one speaker hard to hear
I bought it i own it and it looks like a overpriced toy to me, it doesn't do flash so i cant go to some websites. It doesnt have a real word processor. The 1080 P camera is nothing more than a 5 mega pixel camera and the camera facing the user looks poor. Im glad this came out it will force other tablets to have a 10 hour battery life. Personally i think i would get one that isnt 4 Lte or even the 3rd generation save the money and get the least expensive ipad 2 you want or look around and find a tablet that does what you need; rather than having it tell you what it wants you to use and what it wants you to pay for, itunes and apps.

Item.Item: Apple iPad Wi-Fi + Cellular 16 GB - 3rd generation - Verizon Wireless - Black
Item.ReviewTitle: The Screen makes a huge difference
Item.Review:
Pros: Screen, Performance, Verizon 4G LTE
Cons: Expensive, no Flash or Java
I was an Ipad 2 and can safely say that the upgrade was worth it for me.
The screen is incredible. Everything is so crisp and it is near impossible to see the pixels on a screen that small. - Makes reading Kindle books almost as good as E-Ink - Upscales Iphone only apps crystal clear (i.e. on the Ipad 2, ebay app text looked muddy, text is crisp on the 3rd) - Definitely easier on the eyes reading my emails and spreadsheets. - You can fit your whole desktop screen on the ipad
Verizon 4G - Only wireless carrier that doesnt drop signal on my train ride (Chicago Metra) - Was getting around 15Gb/s Down 7Gb/s up..Awesome - Wireless hotspot built in and works flawl ... essly
I only wished they would have amped up the CPU a little more, and it is w/o a doubt expensive.
At the end of the day, you really need to determine if its the right tool for you vs having a "Cool New Toy"
In my case I use it for corporate email, powerpoint presentations, and as a laptop replacment whenever possible. Still wish it would have flash and Java, but that is never going to happen.
On the fun side, I really like the AirPlay feature which is compatable with my Marantez AV7005. I use the Kindle Cloud App to read books on the train and the screen doesnt disappoint. I didn't game alot on the ipad 2, but that may change because I really want to test it out.
Enough ramble, overall Its a great device, and while a little on the expensive side, is well worth the investment for me. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Apple iPad Wi-Fi + Cellular 16 GB - 3rd generation - Verizon Wireless - Black
Item.Review: I've had the new iPad for about four months. It has a number of failures that make it not practical for a business user. 1. Cannot directly transfer docs, PDF's, etc via USB or SD card. Apple forces you to go to some form of the "cloud" which is fraught with security vulnerabilities for proprietary and senstive data. 2. Finding apps that actually do something in a well layed out screen is a time consuming exercise. Just because there are a 100,000 apps doesn't mean you will be able to find the one that will really help you get something done. 4. Althoug the screen is very pretty and it can play movies, etc. the Ipad most definat ... ely is not a laptop replacement. My six year old ThinkPad is still a far better business tool. The iPad is certainly not worth the $830 I paid for it. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Apple iPad Wi-Fi + Cellular 16 GB - 3rd generation - Verizon Wireless - Black

It is small and light enough to take into environments that would prohibit a laptop (tactical medicine scenarios) and still yields outstanding educational and research output. 32 GB memory has not been an issue thus far.

Item.Item: Apple iPad Wi-Fi + Cellular 16 GB - 3rd generation - Verizon Wireless - Black
Item.Review:
Pros: Good enough hardware, tons of free software for business and kids
Cons: Recharging battery takes quite a lot of time
My advise is you go for black border. It is a lot better when watching movies in a darker room, white border shines a bit annoyingly when lights are dim and your iPad has great intensity.
Another is that do not trouble loading this battery eater with 1amp USB charger, go for better quality charger as this device seems to take several hours to get fully charged.
Some other tablet computers might have even better hardware but it's the combination of software and hardware that makes these great. Also, Apple is the king in keeping complex things simple, usability for the win!

Item.Item: Apple iPad Wi-Fi + Cellular 16 GB - 3rd generation - Verizon Wireless - Black
Item.ReviewTitle: Another good product but not revolutionary
Item.Review:
Pros: 4g connectivity, screen resolution, processing power
Cons: Inability to increase storage capacity
Another good product from Apple; however, was not as revolutionary as the initial iPad.
• Pros = 4g connectivity (lightning fast), beautiful screen, tremendous processing capabilities, better camera, extremely portable and user friendly • Cons = still disappointed with inability to increase storage capacity, this product does get hotter than previous iPads
Overall, I love the new iPad (I purchased the prior 2 versions); however, I do concede that the upgrades over the iPad 2 may not be perceived as that revolutionary. If you have the iPad 2, the incremental changes may not warrant upgrading. If you have no tablet at all, this is the one to get.

Item.Item: Apple iPad Wi-Fi + Cellular 16 GB - 3rd generation - Verizon Wireless - Black
Item.Review:
Pros: ease of use, fun
Cons: um nothing
I love my new iPad! You never know how much you're missing out until you own one. I am a student and it has completely negated the need for me to bring my laptop to class now! I am able to download lecture notes and write directly on them (with an app of course). my bag is a lot lighter carrying this around than my 13" macbook and it keeps an amazing charge! I usually charge it every 3 days or so and this includes the playing of games and use of social networks. i havent activated my 4g service yet but i do like the fact that a data plan isnt necessary to own this specific device and i can activate it right on the device. I can't believe I waited this long to get one but its definitely worth the money and the 6 hours i stood in line wai ... ting for it :) expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Apple iPad Wi-Fi + Cellular 16 GB - 3rd generation - Verizon Wireless - Black
Item.Review:
Pros: simplicity of the device and OS, complete feature set, screen is amazing
Cons: walled garden ecosystem
I've had an ipad 2 since they came out. While that was a great device, the new iPad (iPad 3rd Gen) is the most complete tablet on the market. The screen is amazing, esp if you spend a lot of time reading on the device. The 3G LTE is FAST too. My Verizon service averages around 12 Mbps down. While it might seem like the most expensive option out there, if you're one of those people that hates farting around trying to figure out new electronics, or hate troubleshooting problems with different devices, get this one. It doesn't "just work", it always works.

Item.Item: Apple iPad Wi-Fi + Cellular 16 GB - 3rd generation - Verizon Wireless - Black
Item.Review:
Pros: Resolution on the screen is very nice.
Cons: Will not stay connected to home Wi-Fi for more than 5 minutes when it feels like connecting at all.
My first Apple product ever purchased, expected at the very least for it to be able to detect and keep our home Wi-Fi connection like my Asus netbook does that has survived a cup of coffee being spilled on it. Once the iPad does detect our Wi-Fi I am lucky for five minutes of connection and the few apps I have managed to find have been very slow in downloading. I have already returned one for the same issue and the second one is going back this weekend for full money back. I would not recommend buying the latest version until Apple officially announces they have fixed these problems.
